question: Question_01_(b)
statement:
Define the sets

\[X = \bigcap_{\alpha \in I} S_\alpha\]

and

\[Y = \bigcup_{\alpha \in I} S_\alpha\]
sols:
The set \emph{X} is the \emph{intersection} of all of the sets
\emph{S}\textsubscript{α}; that is, \emph{X} is the set of all \emph{x}
such that, for all α ∈ \emph{I} we have \emph{x} ∈
\emph{S}\textsubscript{α}.

The set \emph{Y} is the \emph{union} of all of the sets
\emph{S}\textsubscript{α}; that is, \emph{Y} is the set of all \emph{y}
such that there exists an α ∈ \emph{I} such that \emph{y} ∈
\emph{S}\textsubscript{α}.
hints: Can you recall what \emph{A}∩\emph{B} and \emph{A}∪\emph{B} are?
